root: ^Not many psychologists practice in rural areas.
^That's why you always do your best to help your clients.
^Small towns need licensed therapists as much as anywhere else does!
^You’ve got a few appointments today so don’t slack off.

start: ^You hear a knock on the door.
first: ^Good morning Dr. Montana. I'm here for my appointment.
second: ^It's Sarah. I had an appointment with you last week. Can I come in?
^Give me a few minutes. I'll call you in when I'm ready.

c-1: ^ Your desk is nice and clean.
c-2: ^ You read the local paper.  There's not much going on
c-3: ^ You should probably call Sarah in soon.

sixth: ^What's causing you to feel this way?
seventh: ^I have a midterm exam next week. Normally I'm confident but this class is really difficult.
^It sounds like you've been working hard
eighth: ^I just don't think I'm ready for this exam and I’m afraid of letting the class harm my gpa.
^How would doing well make you feel?
^So, what happens if you don't do well on the exam?
ninth: ^Let's come up with a goal to help you succeed
^That's great. Let's talk about some ways we can deal with stress
tenth: ^Let's come up with a solution so that doesn't happen
^It’s okay to be angry. Let’s try something..
eleventh: ^I think you need to invest some more time into your mental health
^You should acknowledge that you can only give this midterm your best effort
twelfth: ^But the midterm is all I can think about! I can’t allow myself to get a bad grade by doing something else.
^Okay, tell me more about why you feel that way
thirteenth: ^The truth is that I’m not a very good student. I have to spend a lot of time studying in order to get the results I want.  And I’m always studying because that’s what I need to do to maintain my grades.
^You've invested a lot of time into your academics. I think that's making this exam more stressful for you
^It's okay not to have perfect grades...
fourteenth: ^I guess the stress is more likely to harm my grade than help though, right? If I’m unable to focus because I’m not stressed it could put all my effort to waste..
^Let's talk about ways to reduce your stress
fifteenth: ^No, it’s important to me. Besides you went to medical school right?  How were your grades?
sixteenth: ^Listen to some music, spend some time with friends, go to bed an hour early, you decide
seventeenth: ^I'm still worried about this exam though.
^Let's do some breathing exercises. Next time you feel stressed out, I want you to use them
twentieth: ^Okay, but I'm still a littled stressed.
^Don't think about your exam. Just focus on your breathing. How do you feel?
twentyfirst: ^It's important to slow down and breathe, especially when things get stressful
